Functions¶

class screening_mgmt.screening_mgmt.CmdLine[source]¶

Start simple command processor for debugging/low level functions.

do_EOF(line)[source]¶

Quits the console.

do_close(line)[source]¶

Closes the connection

do_db(line)[source]¶

Applies the command to the connection, stub

do_enter(line)[source]¶

Enters new data sets

do_exe(line)[source]¶

Execute line as SQL statement.

do_exit(line)[source]¶

Quits the console.

do_gui(line)[source]¶

Start the GUI.

do_init(line)[source]¶

Build the database tables.

do_load(line)[source]¶

Load the first ten sets of the routine specified in line

do_quit(line)[source]¶

Quits the console.

do_reset(line)[source]¶

Drop all tables irreversibly and rebuild the basic tables of the database.

do_sql(line)[source]¶

Executes SQL statement

do_summary(line)[source]¶

Show a list of the existing tables and the columns of the table specified in line.

do_ud(line)[source]¶

reloads modules

do_usr(line)[source]¶

Add the user [line].

class screening_mgmt.screening_mgmt.Cpd(conn, **kwargs)[source]¶

Class for the compound table

class screening_mgmt.screening_mgmt.DbConnection(dialect, host, user, pw, db, driver=None, key_val=None)[source]¶

Interface to the database connection.

Set up connection to a supported SQL database via SQLAlchemy and collect the pointers to the ORM.

  • parameters:

    :param dialect: The database protocol. At the moment, *SQLAlchemy*
    supports the following protocols: *drizzle*, *firebird*, *mssql*,
    *mysql*, *oracle*, *postgresql*, *sqlite*, and *sybase*.
:type dialect: String
:param host: The host (e.g. *localhost* or `127.0.0.1`)
:type host: String
:param user: Username
:type user: String
:param pw: Password
:type pw: String
:param db: Database name
:type db: String
:param driver: Driver (default: "")
:param key_val: Additional key values (default: "")
:return: None
:rtype: None

  • Example:

    :Example: balah

  • **See also:

    .. seealso:: blah
batch_load(target, delim=', ', raw_file=None, update=False)[source]¶

Load compound and user information from file.

target – The target database (e.g. Cpd, Rtn, Usr) delim – Delimiter used in txt and csv files, default is comma (”,”).

This value is ignored when treating Excel files.
source_file – The file to be loaded. If omitted, it can be chosen
via a dialog.
connect()[source]¶

Connect to database, create engine and metadata.

Returns two values: A boolean for successful/unsuccessful connection, and a string with a confirmation or error message.

get_summary(routine, user_dir, df, plot=0, list_=1, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a list for on-screen display or writing to file or a plot for on-screen display or writing to file.

Calls the user-defined script associated with the routine. Arguments: routine – The routine to be used df – The database, preferably retrieved via load_results(). plot – boolean, whether plot is to be returned list_ – boolean, whether list is to be returned

load_results(filter_str, sl=True, sp=False, dl=False, dp=False)[source]¶

Retrieve data from the database.

Return the filtered data as a pandas data frame. Has to be called for every routine, since data sets from different routines might be in- compatible. Arguments: filter_str – The filter string (SQLAlchemy syntax) sl – Boolean whether to save the result as a list sp – Boolean whether to save the result as a plot dl – Boolean whether to display the result as a list dp – Boolean whether to display the result as a plot

new_entry(target, data)[source]¶

Insert a new entry into the target table.

Arguments: target – The name of the target database data – A dict where the keys must correspond to the columns of the

target table.
update(table, id_field, id_value, val)[source]¶

Update a field in the database.

Arguments: table – The table that should be updated id_code – The primary key for the row to be updated kwargs – The keys must match the column names, the values are the

updated values.
write_results(routine, user_dir, preview=False, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Write a new dataset to the main table.

The function loads the user scripts from the user’s working directory.

Arguments:

routine – The name of the routine args, kwargs – Will be passed to the user script

exception screening_mgmt.screening_mgmt.DbError(val)[source]¶

An error with the database communication

class screening_mgmt.screening_mgmt.DbConnection(dialect, host, user, pw, db, driver=None, key_val=None)[source]

Interface to the database connection.

Set up connection to a supported SQL database via SQLAlchemy and collect the pointers to the ORM.

  • parameters:

    :param dialect: The database protocol. At the moment, *SQLAlchemy*
    supports the following protocols: *drizzle*, *firebird*, *mssql*,
    *mysql*, *oracle*, *postgresql*, *sqlite*, and *sybase*.
:type dialect: String
:param host: The host (e.g. *localhost* or `127.0.0.1`)
:type host: String
:param user: Username
:type user: String
:param pw: Password
:type pw: String
:param db: Database name
:type db: String
:param driver: Driver (default: "")
:param key_val: Additional key values (default: "")
:return: None
:rtype: None

  • Example:

    :Example: balah

  • **See also:

    .. seealso:: blah
